place.name: DENTON
place.gazetteerText: DENTON, a parish in Depwade district, Norfolk; on the river Waveney and the Waveney Valley railway, near Homersfield r. station, and 3¾ miles SW of Bungay. It has a post office under Harleston. Acres, 2, 437. Real property, £4, 668. Pop., 518. Houses, 113. The property is much subdivided. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Norwich. Value, £813.* Patron, the Archbishop of Canterbury. The church is very good; and there are an Independent chapel, and charities £29. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
